alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL MORA AND SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ocate, or 18 miles northeast of Mora, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocate, Coyote Creek State Park, Ojo Feliz and Guadalupita. This includes State Road 434 between Mile Markers 13 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
